byline.contributor: Simon Romero reported from Brasília, and Vinod Sreeharsha from Rio de Janeiro.
byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and VINOD SREEHARSHA

abstract: Move to impeach Brazilian Pres Dilma Rousseff over corruption scandal is gaining traction, but some of country's most vociferous lawmakers pushing for ouster, including Eduardo Cunha and Paulo Maluf, are facing serious corruption charges themselves; national debate is growing over hypocrisy among Brazil's leaders.
lead_paragraph: Many of the legislators calling for President Rousseff’s impeachment are facing charges that some observers say are more serious than the accusations against her.

headline.main: Dilma Rousseff Targeted in Brazil by Lawmakers Facing Scandals of Their Own
headline.print_headline: Trying to Oust Brazil’s Leader, but Facing Own Graft Charges

snippet: Many of the legislators calling for President Rousseff’s impeachment are facing charges that some observers say are more serious than the accusations against her.
